results.title: Does advertising pay?
results.creator_credit: Alan Strowger, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
In 1965 British industry spent nearly 600 million pounds on advertising and sales promotion. Was the money well spent? Part of a series of films designed to present the theory and practice of modern marketing. Case histories of branded products (failures as well as successes) are given to illustrate particular market problems.

results.title: Dodge your debts
results.brief_description: A fast paced slapstick farce starring Gaylord Lloyd (Harold Lloyd’s brother). Set in England, involves a debt collector, scores of bobbys, a pub, a thug and his beautiful daughter. Cast also includes William Gillespie, Estelle Harrison, George Rowe.

results.title: Doctor woman: life and times of Elizabeth Bagshaw
results.creator_credit: Mark McCurdy, Beryl Fox and Lockwood Films
results.brief_description: A forerunner of the women’s movement, Elizabeth Bagshaw was one of the first women to practice medicine in Canada. In having to overcome society’s bias against women in medicine she helped to instigate changes in public opinion on that issue as well as the issue of birth control. The film captures the personality of this remarkable woman through a contemporary interview and re-enactments of episodes from her youth. The sepia tones of the re-enactments are in keeping with the film techniques of the time, giving the viewer a strong sense of the period. The film is of special interest to people interested in the evolution of woman’s roles in Canadian society. (Awards: Toronto; Columbus)

results.title: Doctor De Soto (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Doctor De Soto, a mouse dentist, refuses to treat animals that are “dangerous” to mice, until one day a fox shows up writhing in pain from a toothache. How Doctor De Soto and his assistant, Mrs De Soto, “outfox the fox” is a humorous story.

results.title: Do you think you can manage? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Darlow, Robert Reid and Video Arts
results.brief_description: A training film for office supervisors and their managers. Explores in personal and human terms the problems which can arise when a clerk is promoted, unprepared for a supervisory job, and suggests some basic and simple methods by which they can be avoided.

results.title: Do detectives think?
results.creator_credit: Fred Guiol, Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios and Pathé Frères
results.brief_description: An escaped convict (Young) is out to kill the judge (Finlayson) who sentenced him. Two inept detectives (Laurel & Hardy) are hired to guard the judge.

results.title: DNA: molecule of heredity
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Dr. George Beadle, discoverer of DNA and Nobel prize winner, explains why DNA, a giant molecule of the cell chromosomes, is the basis of growth and reproduction and the mechanism for transporting hereditary specifications from one generation to the next.

results.title: Divorce = Li Hun [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Wang Haowei and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in Beijing in the early thirties, “Li Hun” recounts the cultural conficts faced by a well-natured match-maker caught between Chinese tradition and the Western ideas of marriage and family that are beginning to take hold amongst his friends. Adapted from the original work by the famous drama writer Lao She. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Division (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The partitive and measure aspects of division are introduced when a group of children discuss two sharing situations and begin to make a wall chart. The program changes direction near the end to show children applying the four operations they have considered, to find as many ways of writing “6” as they can discover.
